item.title: Whatâ€™s the difference between Internship and Field Placement?
item.dc:creator: PR
item.description: Internship is paid employment that enables students to gain long-term practical experience directly related to their programs of study. Internships are optional in most diploma programs and range in duration from four to 16 months.Â Students may choose to participate in the internship program prior to their final semester of study. Once the internship is […]
item.content:encoded:
Internship is paid employment that enables students to gain long-term practical experience directly related to their programs of study. Internships are optional in most diploma programs and range in duration from four to 16 months.Â  Students may choose to participate in the internship program prior to their final semester of study. Once the internship is complete, the students return to school to fulfill their educational requirements.

Field placement provides students with direct and supervised hands-on experience within their field while continuing to engage in academic studies.Â  Field placements vary in duration depending on the academic requirements of the program.Â  For more information on field work required in your program, contact your School office.

item.title: How can I gain relevant work experience in my field while attending BM College?
item.dc:creator: PR
item.description: Students can gain related experience through the Internship program offered through Career Services.Â Many programs also offer field placements as part of their work integrated learning experiences. The exclusive online job board on the Hired portal lists volunteer, part-time and summer opportunities both on- and off-campus.   Upon completion of this course, the student can […]
item.content:encoded:
Students can gain related experience through the Internship program offered through Career Services.Â  Many programs also offer field placements as part of their work integrated learning experiences.

The exclusive online job board on the Hired portal lists volunteer, part-time and summer opportunities both on- and off-campus.

 

  • Upon completion of this course, the student can take the examination to become a VMware Certified Professional (VCP-DCV).
  • The course is based on ESXi V5.5/V6.0, and vCenter Server V5.5/V6.0 (We Cover BOTH VERSIONS!).
  • BM College follows VMware official curriculum, but we the instructors are making sure the presentations include real world case scenarios.

Course Format

  • The course is conducted entirely online, including labs, in an asynchronous manner and it is available to students 24/7.
  • Students can study at their own pace provided they meet the minimum due dates set by the instructor.
  • We don’t have set hours per day, but there is a set maximum of up to 12 hours of training or lab exercises that students can do on a weekly basis as per VITA terms and conditions.
  • The course is 4 weeks in length, approximately 40+ hours of lectures and lab exercises.

Taking this VMware Install, Configure, Manage vSphere V5.5 +V6.0 course at BM college would make you eligible to sit the VCP –DCV exam!

  • VMware requires authorized training in order to attain the VCP credential, in addition to the exam.
  • BM College offers the authorized VMWare Install, Configure, Manage vSphere [v5.5+6.0] course that is a prerequisite to sit the VCP exam and it also counts as college credit.
  • After the class is over you will receive a personal discount voucher (70% off).
  • If you pass the exam you will be awarded with the VMware Certified Professional – Datacenter Virtualization certification.

We can offer the VMware class only to individuals and not as part of corporate training.

  • Students are required to pay out of their own pocket all tuition costs.
  • No company sponsored students are allowed in VMware IT Academy.

Course Outline

This on-line training course explores installation, configuration, and management of VMware® vSphere, which consists of VMware ESXi and VMware vCenter Server.

1. Course Introduction

  • Introductions and course logistics
  • Course objectives

2. Virtualized Data Center

  • Introduce components of the virtualized data center
  • Describe where vSphere fits into the cloud architecture
  • Install and use vSphere Client

3. Creating Virtual Machines

  • Introduce virtual machines, virtual machine hardware, and virtual machine files
  • Deploy a single virtual machine

4. VMware vCenter Server

  • Introduce the vCenter Server architecture
  • Introduce VMware® vCenter Single Sign-On
  • Install and use vSphere Web Client
  • Introduce VMware® vCenter Server Appliance
  • Configure and manage vCenter Server Appliance
  • Manage vCenter Server inventory objects and licenses

5. Configuring and Managing Virtual Networks

  • Describe, create, and manage a standard virtual switch
  • Describe and modify standard virtual switch properties
  • Configure virtual switch load-balancing algorithms

6. Configuring and Managing Virtual Storage

  • Introduce storage protocols and device names
  • Configure ESXi with iSCSI, NFS, and Fibre Channel storage
  • Create and manage vSphere datastores
  • Deploy and manage VMware vSphere® Storage Appliance

7. Virtual Machine Management

  • Use templates and cloning to deploy virtual machines
  • Modify and manage virtual machines
  • Create and manage virtual machine snapshots
  • Perform VMware vSphere® vMotion® and VMware vSphere®
  • Storage vMotion® migrations
  • Create a VMware vSphere® vApp

8. Access and Authentication

  • Control user access through roles and permissions
  • Configure and manage the ESXi firewall
  • Configure ESXi lockdown mode
  • Integrate ESXi with Active Directory

9. Resource Management and Monitoring

  • Introduce virtual CPU and memory concepts
  • Describe methods for optimizing CPU and memory usage
  • Configure and manage resource pools
  • Monitor resource usage using vCenter Server performance graphs and alarms

10. High Availability and Fault Tolerance

  • Introduce the new VMware vSphere® High Availability architecture
  • Configure and manage a vSphere HA cluster
  • Introduce VMware vSphere® Fault Tolerance
  • Describe VMware vSphere® Replication

11. Scalability

  • Configure and manage a VMware vSphere® Distributed Resource Scheduler (DRS) cluster
  • Configure Enhanced vMotion Compatibility
  • Use vSphere HA and DRS together

12. Patch Management

  • Use vSphere Update Manager to manage ESXi patching
  • Install vSphere Update Manager and the vSphere Update Manager plug-in
  • Create patch baselines
  • Scan and remediate hosts

13. Installing VMware Components

  • Introduce ESXi installation
  • Describe boot-from-SAN requirements
  • Introduce vCenter Server deployment options
  • Describe vCenter Server hardware, software, and database requirements
  • Install vCenter Server (Windows-based)


 FAQs

  • What are the requirements?

    • System administration experience working with the Microsoft Windows or Linux operating systems.
    • Understanding of concepts presented in the VMware Data Center Virtualization Fundamentals course for VMware Certified Associate – Data Center Virtualization (VCA-DCV) certification

    Who should attend?

    • System Administrator
    • IT Operations Professionals
    • Technology Professionals seeking VMware Certified Professional – Data Center Virtualization (VCP-DCV) certification
    • Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI) Support Operators responsible for ESXi and vCenter Server

    What’s the curriculum?

    This on-line training course explores installation, configuration, and management of VMware® vSphere, which consists of VMware ESXi and VMware vCenter Server. Upon completion of this course, the student can take the examination to become a VMware Certified Professional. The course is based on ESXi 5.5/6.0, and vCenter Server 5.5/6.0. BM College follows VMware official curriculum, but we the instructors are making sure the presentations include real world case scenarios. You can download the official course curriculum from VMware’s website: https://mylearn.vmware.com/descriptions/EDU_DATASHEET_vSphereInstallConfigureManage_V551.pdf

  • Am I required to take the exam?

    There’s no requirement to take the exam. If you want to become a VCP, then you need to attend a class and pass the exam. For example, on the test you will be asked for some command line solutions, and there are no command line options even explored in the labs. This class is designed to get you familiar with VMware, use it, then get certified.

  • Are the ICM classes enough themselves to pass the VCP-DCV exam?

    This course is a prerequisite and an important part of the exam preparation. To achieve VCP certification you must attend this course.

  • I’m a non-US citizen and live outside of the USA, would it be possible for me to enroll?

    Yes, you can join from any location.

  • Do students get official VMware certificate?

    Yes, you will receive electronic certificate from VMware that you can share with potential employers. The certificate is published on VMware’s website under your account and can be checked for validity online.

item.title: What if my career goals have changed and no longer match my program?
item.dc:creator: PR
item.description: Career Advising can help students answer questions about their career options. This appointment may also provide insight into career exploration, salary expectations, and / or further education options. To help with decision-making, the advisor may introduce a free online interest assessment as well as the Myers-Briggs Type Indicator (MBTI) which assesses personality preferences.Â A nominal […]
item.content:encoded: Career Advising can help students answer questions about their career options. This appointment may also provide insight into career exploration, salary expectations, and / or further education options. To help with decision-making, the advisor may introduce a free online interest assessment as well as the Myers-Briggs Type Indicator (MBTI) which assesses personality preferences.Â  A nominal fee is charged for the MBTI which will be discussed at your initial appointment.Â  Students can book their appointments on the Hired portal, by telephone or in-person.

item.title: What if I don’t know what to do with my diploma once I graduate?
item.dc:creator: PR
item.description: You can book an appointment with a career advisor to explore career options. The career advisor can help to assess a career situation, identify strengths and interests, and provide guidance in setting goals and plans. Career assessment tools are available at reasonable rates through Career Services. For more information, please visit theÂ Hired portal.
item.content:encoded:
You can book an appointment with a career advisor to explore career options. The career advisor can help to assess a career situation, identify strengths and interests, and provide guidance in setting goals and plans. Career assessment tools are available at reasonable rates through Career Services.

For more information, please visit theÂ Hired portal.

item.title: How do I book an appointment with an advisor from Career Services?
item.dc:creator: PR
item.description: Book an appointment through the Hired portal. Log on using your My Campus login information Contact Career Services. Visit the Student Services building Â at the BM College campus or Student Success Centre reception.
item.content:encoded:
• Book an appointment through the Hired portal. Log on using your My Campus login information
  • Contact Career Services.
  • Visit the Student Services building Â at the BM College campus or Student Success Centre reception.

item.title: How can I find an on-campus job while studying at BM College?
item.dc:creator: PR
item.description: Work Study refers to some on-campus jobs that are sponsored through Financial Aid and Awards. Students interested in applying to Work Study jobs must complete the Student Financial Profile, found on MyCampus (under the student tab). Once approved for the program, start applying for the on-campus jobs listed under the Work Study Jobs tab of […]
item.content:encoded:
Work Study refers to some on-campus jobs that are sponsored through Financial Aid and Awards.

Students interested in applying to Work Study jobs must complete the Student Financial Profile, found on MyCampus (under the student tab). Once approved for the program, start applying for the on-campus jobs listed under the Work Study Jobs tab of the Hired Portal.Â  Detailed information on this employment program can be found on the Hired portalor MyCampus.

Please note: not all on-campus job opportunities require students to complete a student financial profile.Â  The Student Association, Aramark, Residence, and Athletics, Student Academic Learning Services and other college departments have hired students for part-time and summer work.

Check out on-campus and off-campus job leads online through the Hired portal. Log on using your MyCampus login information.

item.title: Can I get help with writing a resumÃ© and job searching?
item.dc:creator: PR
item.description: Yes, career advisors are available by appointment to critique cover letters, resumÃ©s and offer suggestions for improvements. Career Services provides one-to one advising appointments in these areas: Cover letter writing Job Search strategies Job Search using LinkedIn Internship Interviewing techniques Mock Interviews Portfolio development
item.content:encoded:
Yes, career advisors are available by appointment to critique cover letters, resumÃ©s and offer suggestions for improvements.

Career Services provides one-to one advising appointments in these areas:

  • Cover letter writing
  • Job Search strategies
  • Job Search using LinkedIn
  • Internship
  • Interviewing techniques
  • Mock Interviews
  • Portfolio development

item.title: How can Career Services help me find a job?
item.dc:creator: PR
item.description: Career advisors are available by appointment to critique cover letters, resumÃ©s and offer suggestions for improvements. We work with BM CollegeÂ students and graduates to assist them in finding full-time, part-time, summer, volunteer and contract positions. Career Services also provides our students and graduates: Access to our exclusive online job board, through the Hired portal Career […]
item.content:encoded:
Career advisors are available by appointment to critique cover letters, resumÃ©s and offer suggestions for improvements. We work with BM CollegeÂ students and graduates to assist them in finding full-time, part-time, summer, volunteer and contract positions.

Career Services also provides our students and graduates:

  • Access to our exclusive online job board, through the Hired portal
  • Career Resources in our Centre and on the Hired portal
  • One-to-one appointments on job search strategies, cover letter and resume writing, portfolio development, and interviewing techniques
  • On-campus employer recruitment activities and events

item.title: How do I register for part-time courses?
item.dc:creator: PR
item.description: Existing full-time student If you wish to take a post-secondary credit course online or through Continuing Education, you must first visit your school office to have your Full-time Equivalent form signed. Then, bring the signed and completed form to the Student Services building and get a ticket to see a student services representative for processing. […]
item.content:encoded:
Existing full-time student If you wish to take a post-secondary credit course online or through Continuing Education, you must first visit your school office to have your Full-time Equivalent form signed. Then, bring the signed and completed form to the Student Services building and get a ticket to see a student services representative for processing.

 

If you wish to add a day course to your current schedule, you may do so via MyCampus. DC Student Administrative Services â€“ Student Information â€“ BM CollegeÂ â€“ Add/Drop Courses. There are computers available at the Welcome Desk to use and during start-up there are additional laptops in the lower level of the Student Services building.

Member of the public

Registration can occur online and for convenience there are computers available at the Welcome Desk to use and during start-up there are additional laptops in the lower level of the Student Services building.

item.title: How do I apply for an equivalent subject/transfer credit?
item.dc:creator: PR
item.description: Course taken at BM College Copy of your course outline is required   Course taken in another institution Copy of your course outline is required Official transcript is required (original, not a copy) Fee required at time of processing the request     Complete an Application for Equivalent Credit form (found on the website and […]
item.content:encoded:
Course taken at BM College
  • Copy of your course outline is required

 
Course taken in another institution
  • Copy of your course outline is required
  • Official transcript is required (original, not a copy)
  • Fee required at time of processing the request

 

 

  • Complete an Application for Equivalent Credit form (found on the website and submit it along with a transcript and subject outline for the course already taken to the Office of the Registrar. If no payment is required or if paying by debit or credit card, documentation can be submitted to the Welcome Desk. If paying by cash or cheque, create a ticket to see a student services representative;
  • May take approximately two weeks to process;
  • You must attend all classes until you have received written approval for the credit; and
  • Student Handbook lists application deadlines for subjects currently on your timetable.
